intro: Cordia uniceps, commonly known as the African snowball, is a shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its showy, white, clustered flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are often elliptical in shape. It produces small, round, yellowish fruits that contain seeds. Cordia uniceps is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to well-drained soils.
